revised_title: Structural Insights into the Catalytic Mechanism of α-Chymotrypsin
tldr: The authors present a detailed analysis of the molecular structure of α-chymotrypsin, a well-studied enzyme. They describe the conformation of the molecule in relation to its hydrogen bonding scheme and discuss the possible catalytic mechanism. The study reveals a new buried acid group that is part of a hydrogen bonding system involving the active serine, which helps explain how serine can become a powerful nucleophile through a "charge relay system." The authors also define the catalytic binding site using diffraction studies of substrate binding.
